intro: Senecio cardamine, commonly known as the yellow pincushion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that are tightly packed, forming a spherical shape resembling a pincushion. Senecio cardamine thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or sandy habitats. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
